citeinfo.origin: Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Ocean Service (NOS), Office for Coastal Management (OCM); Bureau of Ocean Energy Management (BOEM)
citeinfo.title: Pipelines

descript.abstract: This data set contains the locations of oil and gas pipelines in the Unites States Offshore Outer Continental Shelf. The areas found in Alaska were calculated NAD 1983 Alaska Albers Equal Area Conic. All data in the layer is projected into WGS 1984 World Mercator.
descript.purpose: To show locations of oil and gas pipelines from the Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement, BOEM, and coastal states with available offshore pipeline data. As well as, to support coastal and ocean planning and other activities pursuant to the Energy Policy Act, Coastal Zone Management Act, Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act, National Environmental Policy Act, Rivers and Harbors Act and the Submerged Lands Act.
descript.supplinf: This product is a combination of BOEM/BSEE pipelines along with available coastal state data for offshore pipelines.

idinfo.useconst: These data are intended for coastal and ocean use planning. Not for navigation. http://www.marinecadastre.gov/about/disclaimer.html Please check sources, scale, accuracy, currentness and other available information. Please confirm that you are using the most recent copy of both data and metadata.
idinfo.datacred: NOAA Office for Coastal Management, BOEM, BSEE, Alaska, California, Texas, Louisiana, Alabama, Mississippi.

attracc.attraccr: No formal attribute accuracy test was conducted. The attributes in this dataset are believed to be accurate.

dataqual.logic: These data are believed to be logically consistent. Geometry is topologically clean. During quality control, attributes were checked to ensure that they fell within the expected ranges or had expected/valid values. Text attribute values were checked for spelling and usage consistency. No topology tests were conducted.
dataqual.complete: Data from the authoritative sources (identified through open source research) is assumed to be correct and accurate. Spatial and attribute properties are believed to be complete, although attribute information has been simplified. Geometric thresholds from original data are preserved. No tests have been completed for exhaustiveness. Metadata for source data was very hard to come by and not readily available.

horizpa.horizpar: All records were verified to occur within the spatial domain of the feature class/shapefile. Maximum scale of intended use is 1:80,000.

citeinfo.origin: Alaska Department of Natural Resources - Information Resource Management
citeinfo.title: mv_infra_pipeline_ln , Alaska Pipelines 1:63,360
citeinfo.othercit: This data depicts pipeline locations in Alaska state waters as digitized primarily from 1:24,000, 1:63,360, and 1:250,000 USGS quadrangles. The source document that represented the newest information and best geographic location was used to capture the data. All infrastructure from the primary source document was digitized and then supplemented with the information from other source documents for additional or updated infrastructure or attributes - Alaska Albers Equal Area

srcinfo.srccontr: Polyline shapefile of Alaska pipeline data.

citeinfo.title: Federal and State Waters

srcinfo.srccontr: State and Federal waters within the Economic Exclusion Zone of the United States feature class used to clip source datasets.

procstep.procdesc: Once the conflicting data has been edited & remove pipelines that already existed you will be left with pipelines to add to the Pipelines feature class, which can be completed with the Merge tool or utilizing the Editor tool. The Pipelines feature class now has all pipelines added into the attributes.

Create Status_Descrpt & Prod_Descrpt attributes and fill in the information required using the Select by Attribute feature in the table to select for the status code or product code that is provided by BOEM/BSEE. https://www.data.bsee.gov/Main/HtmlPage.aspx?page=pipelineMastersFields#Prod%20Code

Copy all data in the BOEM_MC_Pipelines dataset and save as a new Pipelines feature class. Starting with California, individually confirm Emmy_oil.shp , Emmy_oil_and_low_pressure_gas.shp , Emmy_water_and_high_pressure_gas.shp , Esther_gas.shp , Esther_oil.shp , Eva_gas.shp , Eva_oil.shp , Holly_gas.shp , Holly_oil.shp , Holly_Power_Cable.shp , & spps tent gas.shp attributes were not present in BOEM data and added to the Pipelines feature class using the Editor.
Merged the BOEM_Pacific_Pipelines_2011-08 & ppl_arcs projected layers into one layer called BOEM_MC_Pipelines.

Utilizing the select by location for all other layers individually NaturalGas_Pipelines_US_201804_project_erase , PetroleumProduct_Pipelines_US_201801_project_erase, ME_project_erase, mv_infra_pipeline_ln_project_erase , MS_Natural_Gas_Pipelines_project_erase , LAPipelinesfromTIMS_project_erase, Offshore_pipelines_project_erase select the attributes that intersect with the Pipelines feature class & export this data with a naming convention that ends in layername_Conflict & add this back to your map. Reselect the data that intersects the Pipelines using the Select by location and reverse the selection so that you have all of the pipelines that are not currently present in the Pipelines feature class, using the Editor copy the data into Pipelines feature class.

Create attributes STATUS_CODE, PPL_SIZE_CODE, PROD_CODE, SDE_COMPANY for each layer and populate using the information available from each layer assuring that schema is matching to the BOEM/BSEE layers - https://www.data.bsee.gov/Main/HtmlPage.aspx?page=pipelineMastersFields#Prod%20Code . Turn off attributes in the fields tab that will not be needed moving forward for all 20 data layers/deleted empty attributes so that when exported only the important attributes move forward.

Project all source layers into WGS_1984_World_Mercator & erase any pipelines that fall on land using the USAStateTerritoriesAssociatedAreas feature class with the FederalAndStateWaters layer removed from it to assure pipelines falling in State Waters were captured. Each layer was named with "_project" after it was properly projected and the layers that had to have space erased had "_erase" after this step was completed.

Create the Length attribute and utilize the calculate geometry function and calculate the length in meters. Select the Alaska data, export & project into Alaska Albers Equal Area & calculate the length in meters within this projection. Take the Alaska Equal Area length calculations for each attribute and replace them in the proper place in the Pipeline feature class. The calculations for the Alaska data will be from Albers Equal Area, but the layer and data are still projected into World_Mercator.

The Pipelines feature class with now have all data that was not conflicting from all layers present. Go through each "layername_Conflicting" data set utilizing the Editor tool and remove any pipelines that you can confirm are already present in the Pipelines feature class. Utilize the STATUS_CODE, PPL_SIZE_CODE, PROD_CODE,& SDE_COMPANY attributes that you already filled out to see if the data is truly already present. If a pipeline did not have information available & a N/A was filled in it will not be possible to determine if this line has already been gathered so it should be left in.
Cleaned up attributes to read more clearly. Set attribute alias.

enttyp.enttypd: A collection of attributes for USA oil and gas pipelines.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The company on file for owning the pipeline.

attrdomv.udom: A string of characters representing the company name.

attr.attrdef: The length of the pipeline section, in meters, calculated withing ArcMap.
Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The description of the product code for the type of product found within the pipeline.

attrdomv.udom: A sentence describing the product type within the pipeline.

attr.attrdef: The description of the status code for the status of the pipeline.

attrdomv.udom: A sentence describing the most current status of the pipeline.

attr.attrdef: The product flowing through the pipeline.
